text: It makes no sense to use HubSpot as a headless cms because it has too much data not avaibable in the REST API.

You are losing all the benefits of the CMS yet you are making it quite complicated and poor updating experience :smile: But if you we’re to do it I bet people would google and you would get visibility from the case study (if you we’re to make one)….. If thats what you are after. :smile:
<@UKQP9KM8A> interesting, would it makes sense if more data would be available via API?

We have a problem on a landing page, we try to load the stylesheet and javascript from an external domain. But the domain is replaced with the landing page domain on publish. It works in preview mode. Any solutions?

A headless cms should provide you a unpaginated, not/high enough rate limited, all data API. Things that are not provided by HubSpot. HubSpot is a great CMS as a complete solution, not as a backend or a frontend.

<@U22PKFRU5> if I used HubDB it’d have to be no more than 8ish columns worth of fields. Otherwise, I’d say it would be a content editors’ nightmare. So the page would have to be super-simple. But once you get into repeatable fields, or anything remotely complicated, HubDB would be out the door.

For more complicated content, I’d use the page publishing api and try to access custom module fields for more complicated content via `widget_containers` and `widget_data`.

Then, I’d look into transforming the HubSpot editor into a content reporting tool, so content editors could get a birds eye view of their content (it would just be another “backend” view in HubSpot’s editor). It’d be a lotta work and the client would have to really wanna fork out some dinero lol. I’m not even sure if it’s possible, but that is what I would play around with
yes I know CLI is the better method for pushing and we'll be reworking our workflow... but in the meantime... is anybody having trouble with HubSpot FTP again?
Not FTP particularly, but I'm having some struggles with the file manager sidebar in the DM. I suspect it might be related to the image resizing change that was made:
Is there a way to see how many visits a blog listing page gets?

This is all suuuuuper helpful. I'm just trying to learn and explore what's possible. Love seeing what all our wicked smart and creative HubSpot web developers are doing.

Thank you for the ideas :slightly_smiling_face:  (sharing ideas with various teams for deeper exploration).

would it make sense to have an extra channel to discuss broader subjects like this? i think some discussions are way to precious to get not beeing recognized because of a lot of activity in the channel?
